data.title: Women in Iran are cutting their hair short and dressing as men in a bid to bypass state 'morality' police who rigorously enforce penalties for not wearing a hijab.
US releases Guantánamo prisoner after 14 years and no conviction

'It keeps happening,' rape survivor says: Protests against American military presence in Japan continued on Saturday, as the country’s defense minister lodged a formal complaint over the latest case of alleged murder and rape of a young Japanese woman by a US military base employee

Japanese pop star Mayu Tomita, age 20, is in critical condition after being stabbed by a 27-year-old male, Tomohiro Iwazaki, nearly two dozen times after 'not giving a clear answer' about a gift he had given her earlier. He had ambushed her while she was waiting to come onstage and perform.
1.4 billion yen ($12.7 million) stolen from 1,400 convenience store ATMs across Japan in the space of two hours
Snowden calls for whistleblower shield after claims by new Pentagon source
50 million Africans face hunger after crops fail again

Anti-corporate activists, organic farmers, Indigenous peoples, environmental groups and others took to the streets across 6 continents and over 400 cities on Saturday in a global grassroots march against Monsanto

Chinese and Russian warplanes have been increasingly aggressive intercepting U.S. military aircraft and patrolling near America’s West Coast, prompting the Air Force’s top combat officer to label their provocations one of his top worries.
Turkey's prime minister formally submitted his resignation on Sunday.
Taliban leader Mullah Akhtar Mansour had been killed in an attack by U.S. drones
EgyptAir crash: Internal blast 'tore right side' of jet, pilot says
31 possible Rio Olympians 'failed drug tests' in Beijing
Israel defense chief quits, warns of extremist rise under Netanyahu

Islamic State threatens attacks in India. Islamic State mocked Muslims living in harmony with Hindus who worship cows, trees and the sun, and urged them to travel to IS-held territories in the Caliphate.
